hillbillies.model.vector

Class IntVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.vector.IntVector

  • @Value
public class IntVector
extends java.lang.Object
    Java doesn't allow math on general number type -> we can't use generics.

      • IntVector

        public IntVector(int x,
                 int y,
                 int z)
        Create a new IntVector with the given x, y and z coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        z - The z coordinate
        Postcondition:
        The given coordinates are used
            new.getX() == x && new.getY() == y && new.getZ() == z

      • IntVector

        public IntVector(int[] coords)
        Create a new IntVector with the given coordinates
        Parameters:
        coords - x, y and z coordinates in a int array
        Postcondition:
        The given coordinates are used
            new.getX() == coords[0] && new.getY() == coords[1] && new.getZ() == coords[2]
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given array must have length three | coords.length != 3

    • Method Detail

      • multiply

        public IntVector multiply(int scalar)
        Multiplies the vector with the given constant.
        Parameters:
        scalar - | The constant with which each coordinate is multiplied
        Returns:
        A new vector where each value is multiplied by the scalar.
            result.getX() == this.getX() * scalar &&
            result.getY() == this.getY() * scalar &&
            result.getZ() == this.getZ() * scalar

      • divide

        public IntVector divide(int divisor)
        Divides the vector with the given constant.
        Parameters:
        divisor - | The constant with which each coordinate is divided.
        Returns:
        A new vector where each value is divided by divisor.
            result.getX() == this.getX() / divisor &&
            result.getY() == this.getY() / divisor &&
            result.getZ() == this.getZ() / divisor

      • add

        public IntVector add(int constant)
        Adds the given constant to each coordinate of the vector
        Parameters:
        constant - | The constant
        Returns:
        A new vector where the constant is added to each value.
            result.getX() == this.getX() + constant &&
            result.getY() == this.getY() + constant &&
            result.getZ() == this.getZ() + constant

      • add

        public IntVector add(int dx,
                     int dy,
                     int dz)
        Adds the given constant to each coordinate of the vector
        Parameters:
        dx - the x diff
        dy - the y diff
        dz - the z diff
        Returns:
        A new vector where dx, dy and dz is added to each value.
            result.getX() == this.getX() + dx &&
            result.getY() == this.getY() + dz &&
            result.getZ() == this.getZ() + dy

      • add

        public IntVector add(IntVector other)
        Adds the given vector to this vector
        Parameters:
        other - | The vector to be added
        Returns:
        A new vector which is the sum of two vectors.
            result.getX() == this.getX() + other.getX() &&
            result.getY() == this.getY() + other.getY() &&
            result.getZ() == this.getZ() + other.getZ()

      • subtract

        public IntVector subtract(IntVector other)
        Subtracts the given vector to this vector
        Parameters:
        other - | The vector to be subtracted
        Returns:
        A new vector which is the difference between the two vectors.
            result.getX() == this.getX() - other.getX() &&
            result.getY() == this.getY() - other.getY() &&
            result.getZ() == this.getZ() - other.getZ()

      • dot

        public int dot(IntVector other)
        Calculates the dot product of 2 vectors
        Parameters:
        other - | The other vector for the dot product
        Returns:
        The dot product
            result == (this.getX()*other.getX() + this.getY()*other.getY() + this.getZ()*other.getZ())

      • norm

        public double norm()
        Calculates the norm of the vector
        Returns:
        The norm of this vector.
            result == Math.sqrt(this.dot(this))

      • isEqualTo

        public boolean isEqualTo(IntVector other)
        Compares two vectors
        Parameters:
        other - | The vector with which this vector is compared
        Returns:
        True if the two vectors are equal and the other vector is effective, False otherwise.
            result == (other != null
                       && Util.fuzzyEquals(this.getX(), other.getX(), eps)
                       && Util.fuzzyEquals(this.getY(), other.getY(), eps)
                       && Util.fuzzyEquals(this.getZ(), other.getZ(), eps))

      • toIntArray

        public int[] toIntArray()
        Converts the vector to an array of ints
        Returns:
        An array with length three where each element is either x, y or z.
            result.length == 3 &&
            result[0] == this.getX() &&
            result[1] == this.getY() &&
            result[2] == this.getZ()

      • toVector

        public Vector toVector()
        Creates a new (double) vector from this intVector. (if cube centres are needed don't forget to ad Lc/2)
        Returns:
        A vector with the same values.
            result.getX() == this.getX() &&
            result.getY() == this.getY() &&
            result.getZ() == this.getZ()

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Check whether this vector is equal to the given object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object with which to compare the vector.
        Returns:
        True if the vectors have the same values.
            result == obj != null &&
              obj.getClass().equals(IntVector.class) &&
              this.isEqualTo((IntVector)obj)

      • isNextTo

        public boolean isNextTo(IntVector vector)
        Returns true if two vectors are next to each other.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector that may be next to this vector.
        Returns:
        True if they are next to each other.
            result == Math.abs(vector.getX() - this.getX()) <= 1
              && Math.abs(vector.getY() - this.getY()) <= 1
              && Math.abs(diff.getZ() - this.getZ()) <= 1
